Class PlayerPiece

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
PlayerPiece
public class PlayerPiece extends greenfoot.Actor
Represents a player's game piece -- player 1's pieces (for player index 0) are red spaceships, player 2's pieces (for player index 1) are blue spaceships.
Version:
Final Version
Author:
bickfori@email.uscb.edu

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    act()
    The `act` method for the PlayerPiece is fairly simple since most of the game logic is handled by the GameBoard class; but we will use the `act` method to set the opacity (transparency) of the object depending on whether or not the piece is moveable

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerPiece

      public PlayerPiece(int playerIndex, int originalXcoord, int originalYcoord, int pieceTier)
      Initializes a newly-instantiated PlayerPiece object
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - the index of the player that "owns" this PlayerPiece (0 = red, 1 = blue)
      originalXcoord - the original X-coordinate of where this playerPiece was located for this player's "starting zone"
      originalYcoord - the original Y-coordinate of where this playerPiece was located for this player's "starting zone"
      pieceTier - the tier level of a given playerPiece

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act()
      The `act` method for the PlayerPiece is fairly simple since most of the game logic is handled by the GameBoard class; but we will use the `act` method to set the opacity (transparency) of the object depending on whether or not the piece is moveable
      Overrides:
      act in class greenfoot.Actor

    • setImageForPiece

      public void setImageForPiece()
      This sets the appropriate image based off the player's team and the tier of the playerPiece.

    • isMoveable

      public boolean isMoveable()
      Getter method for retrieving this player piece's `moveable` state value (true or false)

    • setMoveable

      public void setMoveable(boolean moveable)
      Updates the moveable state of this PlayerPiece object
      Parameters:
      moveable - whether this object should be moveable or not

    • getOriginalXcoord

      public int getOriginalXcoord()
      Getter method for retrieving the original X-coordinate of this PlayerPiece
      Returns:
      originalXcoord returns the original x-coordinate of a PlayerPiece prior to movement

    • getOriginalYcoord

      public int getOriginalYcoord()
      Getter method for retrieving the original Y-coordinate of this PlayerPiece
      Returns:
      originalYcoord returns the original y-coordinate of a PlayerPiece prior to movement

    • getGameBoardLocationIndex

      public int getGameBoardLocationIndex()
      Getter method for retrieving the current gameBoardLocationIndex for this PlayerPiece
      Returns:
      gameBoardLocationIndex returns the index value of where the current PlayerPiece is on the board

    • setGameBoardLocationIndex

      public void setGameBoardLocationIndex(int gameBoardLocationIndex)
      Setter method for UPDATING the gameBoardLocationIndex for this PlayerPiece
      Parameters:
      gameBoardLocationIndex - the current gameBoardLocationIndex

    • getTargetGameBoardLocationIndex

      public int getTargetGameBoardLocationIndex()
      Getter method for retrieving the possible game board location index based on the current die roll
      Returns:
      targetGameBoardLocationIndex returns the location the index value for the PlayerPiece based on the current die roll if it were the piece to be moved

    • setTargetGameBoardLocationIndex

      public void setTargetGameBoardLocationIndex(int targetGameBoardLocationIndex)
      Setter method for updating the possible TARGET game board location index based on the current die roll
      Parameters:
      targetGameBoardLocationIndex - The possible TARGET game board location index for this piece, given the current die roll

    • setShipTierName

      public void setShipTierName(String name)
      Setter for the name of each tier of spaceship to a historical reference. Although the names are set individually for each ship, they name corresponds to the tier level of the ship
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the tier of ship

    • getShipTierName

      public String getShipTierName()

      Returns:
      shipTierName The name for the space ship
